data.event: The town was first settled around 1804.
The town was formed in 1821 from part of the Town of Le Ray.
In 1872, the community of Philadelphia set itself off from the town by incorporating as a village.

event.title: 1959, the Indian River Central High School (New York) opened

data.event: In 1959, the Indian River Central High School (New York) opened, serving students from the towns of Philadelphia, Theresa, Antwerp, Leray, Pamelia, the villages of Philadelphia, Theresa, Antwerp, Evans Mills, the hamlet of Calcium and the federal military installation of Fort Drum.

event.title: was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1995

data.event: The Sterlingville Archeological District was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1995.
